activities: Dropbox provides a website, software, and mobile applications that allow people to store files, synchronize files across multiple devices, and collaborate with others. Certain Dropbox services may also be accessed by Application Programming Interfaces (APIs). Some Dropbox services are free of charge and others are paid. Dropbox also offers a service called Mailbox that lets people manage their third-party email accounts and a service called Carousel that lets people manage and share their photos and videos. Dropbox collects personal information from individuals in EU member states and Switzerland for the purposes of providing and improving these services, entering into contracts, providing customer support, and enforcing its Terms of Service. Dropbox also collects personal information from employees to provide human resources services, to comply with applicable laws, and to provide internal security services.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-line data, organization human resources data, off-line data
